result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katherine L Dercola

records.addlTxt:
10:25 AM Attorney Mark P. Powers Aty in court for Katherine L Dercola. Attorney appears by authorization. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Defense is still working on discovery issues, and requests date. Defense has discovery, does not have an offer yet. 
State forwards PTO.  
Court sets hearing.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

8:32 AM Defendant Katherine L Dercola in court.  Attorney Alex Huppertz for Attorney Mark P. Powers Aty in court for Katherine L Dercola.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
